body: @jai1 updated, will change the defaults together in a separate PR
@lucperkins @mgodave any updates for the schema documentation?
@sijie pinging. This is ready for review again.
retest this please // timeout on unit tests
Weird. It looks like the test hangs on MessageIdTest for over 2 hours. Obviously nothing to do with this change though.
@jai1 This doesn't seem to me a super-critical error to stop the current RC. I think we can bump to 2.0.1 where we'll get all fixes (and we should do soon).
@merlimat - ok changed the milestone to 2.0.1, can you review this PR
@ivankelly yeah. will review. I was holding it after Matteo cut the 2.0 branch.
@merlimat I made some additional changes that will fix the issue with the REST API docs not being generated.

@zhaijack @sijie @merlimat 

Need to fix something in BlockAwareSegmentInputStream, and the test needs to touch an internal, so moving files first.

The function is used in multiple places. 1) the upload function and 2) create function. 
The patterns are a little different in the sense that in the create function, the logic generates a tenant/namespace/function package name and stores it in that path

> The function is used in multiple places

@srkukarni fixed it. can you please give a look.
@mgodave We also need the same in `pulsar-client-kafka-compat/pulsar-client-kafka-shaded/pom.xml`
Yes, it looks like a copy&paste artifact. @zhaijack  can you take a look?

@sschepens I think to remember that there was some fix between Rocksdb-5.5.5 and 5.8 to handle these cases, though I haven't found the PR/commit yet. 

> I found this issue on rocksdb which talks about poor iterato4 performance when iterating through lots of tombstoned items, seems like this could be the case, or at least it expresses the same simptoms. 

There shouldn't be many tombstones in this case, since we're doing a `DeleteRange()` from (ledgerid, 0) to (ledgerId+1, 0). The delete range drops the range in a single shot, but it has additional logic and in rocksdb-5.5 there were some of these issues.

I would suggest to either upgrade bookies, or at least upgrade the `rocksdbjni.jar` to 5.8.6 or newer.

> We tried rebuilding the rocksdb index iusing bookkeeper cli and that seemed to work ok, maybe because that rebuilding made a clean index without tombstones?

Correct, rebuilding the index scans the entry logs and reconstruct a new index from scratch, so it would not have the baggage of the old index.
@srkukarni thanks for the review.  I have addressed your comments
@merlimat I would like to upgrade bookkeeper straight to official Apache 4.7, are these versions compatible with the Yahoo version of bookkeeper and with pulsar 1.20?

Yes @sschepens , the bookies on 4.7 are perfectly compatible with the bookkeper client from yahoo branch, which based on 4.3 release. Some care would only be required if authentication (broker->bookie) was enabled, but I don't think that's relevant for anyone except Yahoo (since there are not even auth plugin implementation available fro 4.3 in OSS).
@ivankelly @sijie, Would you please help review it Thanks
Let's keep processing Guarantees for now and get some feedback from users.
@rdhabalia can you review this again? I think @jerrypeng has addressed your comment.
@mgodave can you take a look at @merlimat 's comments?
Depends on #1739, which needs to go in first.
Having been bit by this behavior many times, +100 for this change
@merlimat I've restructured the schema interface to use `ByteBuffer` instead of byte arrays, but I'm not sure if this is what you're looking for. If not, this work may be better left to Dave.
@merlimat Okay, I understand what you're getting at now. Will change or delegate to Dave if necessary.
@ivankelly @sijie Would you please help review it? Thanks.
@srkukarni  how does it look like now?

> I would suggest adding a Test for the C APIs

As I mentioned in the past PR, I'll be adding tests from Go to cover both APIs in one shot.
@bruth Thanks for great comments. I'll go through them in detail
One approach would be to make WindowExecutor function client side?
Since this is a smallish change, would rather do it here itself? It actually simpifies the code of kafka source

@srkukarni  well I thought you didn't like that approach since WindowFunction would be an abstract class that users would extend.  It would simplify the server side.  This would become the same approach as PushSource in the other PR
@srkukarni using a push source might be more efficient since not we are doing async reads in a sense.  Remember the actual source called synchronously.  It can only process on tuple at a time

Can we keep the simple Function(Collection<>) interface that we have and still implement WindowExecutor client side? That way in cmdfunctions(at client side), you would pass classname as WindowExecutor with the user's class as one of the parameter for this
@srkukarni but isn't that just the same as using the PushSource but instead you a pulling the queuing logic back into the KafkaSource?
Not really. Infact this is closer to Storm's KafkaSpout which is a pull model
@merlimat @aahmed-se I reworked these when checking 2.0 rc3. I think they're ready to merge now.
